H0.text: Raises the freezing point, which causes the ice to begin melting when salt is added.

H1.text: Lowers the freezing point is the reason the ice begins to melt when salt is added to ice.

H2.text: Raises the boiling point is what occurs when salt is added to ice, causing the ice to melt.

H3.text: Lowers the boiling point is the reason the ice begins to melt when salt is added to it.

A4.text: Lowering the freezing point allows the street ice to melt at lower temperatures, preventing the accumulation of dangerous, slippery ice.

A5.text: Road salting takes advantage of this effect to lower the freezing point of the ice it is placed on.
